contentheadline.headline: Young Person's Guide to the Orchestra

contentrichtext.text: {{unreferenced|date=April 2012}} {{about|the television series|the composition by Benjamin Britten|The Young Person's Guide to the Orchestra}} The classical TV series '''''Young Person's Guide to the Orchestra''''' was created by world-renowned orchestra conductor [[Leonard Bernstein]], in 1960. Bernstein created the show for the purpose of exposing young viewers, mainly school-aged children, not just to [[European classical music]], but to various kinds of [[orchestra|orchestral instrument]]s as well. It was a weekly show on [[CBS]], and then [[PBS]] picked up the show in 1972. {{DEFAULTSORT:Young Person's Guide To The Orchestra}} [[Category:American children's television series]] {{nonfiction-tv-prog-stub}}
